alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:46PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Arapahoe, northeastern Denver and central Adams Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 544 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Prospect Valley to 11 miles south of Keenesburg to 4 miles southeast of Lochbuie, or along a line extending from 29 miles southwest of Fort Morgan to 21 miles northeast of Denver. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Strong winds were occurring far out ahead of these storms. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eastern Aurora, Brighton, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Bennett, Watkins, Byers, Manila Village and Strasburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. The gusty winds will occur well ahead of thunderstorms or any weakening showers or sprinkles.
